subject: Education
title: Maslow's Hierarchy: Needs Before Motivation
description: A 60-second lesson on Maslow's Hierarchy: Needs Before Motivation.

hook.text: A hungry child can't focus on fractions. Maslow knew why: unmet basic needs block higher learning.

buildup.text: Maslow's hierarchy ranks needs: physiological, safety, belonging, esteem, then self-actualization.

discovery.text: Students must feel safe, fed, and socially connected before academic motivation can take root.

twist.text: The hierarchy isn't rigid stairsâ€”people can pursue growth needs even when lower needs aren't fully met.

climax.text: Schools that address basic needsâ€”breakfast programs, counselors, safe spacesâ€”see academic gains.

punchline.text: You can't inspire a mind that's busy surviving.

quiz.question: What does Maslow's hierarchy imply for education?
options: Basic needs like safety and belonging must be addressed before motivation can flourish
Students should only study subjects at the top of the pyramid
Academic achievement automatically satisfies all lower needs
